results.title: The Types of Plastics Families Should Avoid
results.abstract: If it seems like plastic is everywhere, that’s because it is. But there are easy ways to limit your exposure.

results.title: A New Weight Watchers App for Kids Raises Concerns
results.abstract: Kurbo by WW promises to fight childhood obesity by teaching kids aged 8 to 17 healthy eating strategies — but is it ever a good idea to teach kids how to diet?

multimedia.caption: The Kurbo by WW app prompted a backlash on social media this week, as thousands of users voiced their concerns.

results.title: Asthma Is Absent Among Top Covid-19 Risk Factors, Early Data Shows
results.abstract: Despite warnings that asthmatics were at higher risk for severe illness from the coronavirus, asthma is showing up in only about five percent of New York State’s fatal Covid cases.

multimedia.caption: Rochelle Allen, right, a respiratory therapist in Oakland, Calif., listening to the lungs of patient with asthma during a home visit last month.

results.title: Disposable N95 Masks Can Be Decontaminated, Researchers Confirm
results.abstract: Several methods are effective at killing the new coronavirus on N95 masks — primary protective gear for health care workers — for two or three rounds of use.
org_facet: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

multimedia.caption: UV lights for disinfecting masks, which would hang on clothespins, at the University of Nebraska Medical Center in Omaha.
